title: Liquidity Pools Explained
description: A fast breakdown of Liquidity Pools Explained for builders.

hook.text: A liquidity pool is a pot of paired tokens locked in a smart contract. It powers decentralized trading.

buildup.text: Instead of matching buyers and sellers, pools let traders swap against the pooled funds. Prices adjust by formula.

discovery.text: The constant product formula â€” x times y equals k â€” automatically sets prices based on pool ratios.

twist.text: Large trades in small pools cause slippage. The price moves against you the bigger your trade.

climax.text: Liquidity pools replaced order books with pure math. They made trading possible without a centralized exchange.

punchline.text: A math formula replaced thousands of Wall Street traders.

quiz.question: What determines token prices in a liquidity pool?
options: A mathematical formula based on pool ratios
